pullRequest.body:
If `S` is the localization of `R` at a submonoid `M`, then `MvPolynomial σ S` is the localization of `MvPolynomial σ R` at the image of `M` in `MvPolynomial σ R`.

---

🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/03b6e194-5fc0-4cd9-8f88-528dbc3f2a1f) for commit 817ca55461f60a48b55b66cb1e9d9a28d344fcee.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/7c287dff-9838-4a72-9467-d73f20f086a8/to/03b6e194-5fc0-4cd9-8f88-528dbc3f2a1f) against commit 41c8f830e95264cd8d2f016dec2e3ea02481901f.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9654082537/job/26627624471)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9654082537/job/26627624953)
Thanks for the reviews!
Should `h` be unbundled? (That is `(a) (ha : f.support) (ha' : g a (f a) * n₁ = g a (f a) * n₂)`)
What is the reasoning behind this? These look fine to me at first glance.
With the new `algHom_C`, this is provable by `simp`.
This gives a diamond for `Algebra (MvPolynomial σ R) (MvPolynomial σ (MvPolynomial σ R))`. Please include the warning in the docstring and maybe not have it as a instance by default.
I made it a `local instance`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/MvPolynomial): multivariate polynomials preserve localization
